ngiemboon: Afùɔ Ndavîd la gɔɔn mbwó láʼ ntsèm ngie: «Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn Salémo gẅie Ssé la tsɔ́ʼ, nyě ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ múɔshùm gẅie aa kaa tsɔ́ nò zsé. Afàʼ gie mé gẅiin léfaʼ piŋ ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, anɔʼ gie à gee ńkwɛ́ɛ, á té ye nyìŋ mesoŋ wɔ́, táʼ à gee ńkwɛ́ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé.
en: Then King David said to all the assembly, “My son Solomon #— #God has chosen him alone #— #is young and inexperienced. The task is great   because the building will not be built for a human but for the Lord God.  # 29:1 1Ch 29:19

ngiemboon: N ka pú sáʼ yɔ́ɔn metʉ̀ tà ńcúʼte shúm sie ngwɔ́, mé lɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá Ssé yɔ̀ɔn: n ka cúʼte tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ, mbɔɔ nkáb, mbɔɔ tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀, mbɔɔ metʉ̌, mbɔɔ metÿǒ mie mé ge lɔg nyɛte shúm ntsèm. N ka cúʼte metǒon tà é gyɔ́ɔn, é mie mé tóŋo lê kɔɔnaline, mbɔɔ metǒon mie mé ge lɔg kẅiŋ ndá, mbɔɔ séssé metǒon, mbɔɔ metsɔ́ mentí tà ńgyɔ́ɔn, mbɔɔ metsɔ́ metǒon tʉ̀nzẅìŋ, mbɔɔ tsɔ́ metǒon mie é fɔ́g fɔ̌g tà é gyɔ́ɔn.
en: So to the best of my ability I’ve made provision for the house of my God:   gold for the gold articles, silver for the silver, bronze for the bronze, iron for the iron, and wood for the wood, as well as onyx, stones for mounting,  # 29:2 Or mosaic antimony,  # 29:2 In Hb, the word antimony is similar to “turquoise” ; Ex 28:18.,# 29:2 Ex 28:18 stones of various colors, all kinds of precious stones, and a great quantity of marble.

ngiemboon: Ntí gie n dɔg ńkwoŋ ndá Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, e gÿǒ tà mèŋ n gíŋe ńnáa kwàʼ yɔ́ɔn tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ mbɔɔ yɔ̀ɔn nkáb, ńdɔg ńkẅiʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie n ka vɔg ńcwoŋte ńzáb, ńtí ndá Ssé.
en: Moreover, because of my delight in the house of my God, I now give my personal treasures of gold and silver for the house of my God over and above all that I’ve provided for the holy house:

ngiemboon: N ge náa tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ gie á lʉ́ate, á ye Ofîi tà à gwɔ́ metónà nkÿo, é ná nkáb gie e lʉaté, tà e gwɔ́ metónà nkÿo pʉ́a né móm lekùɔ, mé lɔg ńkẅiŋ membùm ndá.
en: 100 tons  ,# 29:4 1Ch 22:14 of gold (gold of Ophir  # 29:4 1Kg 9:28) and 250 tons  # 29:4 Lit 7,000 talents of refined silver for overlaying the walls of the buildings,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, awɔ̌ aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, gẅie à kwoŋó lénáa tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ka pɔ́ nkáb wɔ́ɔ á mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a légwɔ́ gie ngàŋlevfò ge lɔg shúm tʉ̀nzẅìŋ se tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ mbɔɔ se tʉ̌ nkáb, é lɔg faʼ?»
en: the gold for the gold work and the silver for the silver, for all the work to be done by the craftsmen. Now who will volunteer to consecrate himself to the Lord today? ”

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, patyé twómvfò na metsìŋendá, mbɔɔ metándá mengẅɛ̀te pa Ésàlayɛ, mbɔɔ metándá pie é sáʼa nùɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù ntsáʼ, mbɔɔ pie é sáʼa palÿɔ́ʼncù nkÿo, ńgÿo patyé twómvfò na menùɔ pafaʼa mbwó fùɔ, la kwoŋ kwoŋ, ńná sɔ́b shúm.
en: Then the leaders of the households, the leaders of the tribes of Israel, the commanders of thousands and of hundreds,   and the officials in charge of the king’s work  # 29:6 1Ch 27:25–31 gave willingly.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gʉa na nò mefàʼ ndá Ssé, ńnáa tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ metónà nkÿo né móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńná mepàg tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ntsáʼ legém, ńná nkáb metónà nkÿo tá, ńnáa tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ metónà nkÿo ntɔgɔ́, ńgÿo tʉ̌ metónà ntsáʼ tá.
en: For the service of God’s house they gave 185 tons   of gold and 10,000 gold coins,  # 29:7 Or drachmas, or darics,# 29:7 Ezr 2:69; Neh 7:70 375 tons  # 29:7 Lit 10,000 talents of silver, 675 tons  # 29:7 Lit 18,000 talents of bronze, and 4,000 tons  # 29:7 Lit 100,000 talents of iron.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a pie é la gẅiin metǒon tʉ̀nzẅìŋ la ne ńnáa mbwó Yeyiyɛ gẅie aa nyìŋ na nkenkÿo tsìŋendá Ngeshÿoŋ, páʼ mé ge néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ shúm fùʼ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: Whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the Lord’s house under the care of Jehiel   the Gershonite.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ la pú ńkág tɛʼ ńtí shúm sie pɔ́ nǎ, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la lɔg pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo ńnáa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; afùɔ Ndavîd la gíŋe ḿbú ńkág yé tɛʼ.
en: Then the people rejoiced because of their leaders’ willingness to give, for they had given to the Lord wholeheartedly.   King David also rejoiced greatly.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ Ndavîd la tyé mvfò láʼ, ńná ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ńgɔɔn ngie: «Legúʼ gwɔ́ mbwó gù ngwòŋ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù Ssé Yakwɔ̂b gẅie aa mángʉanjʉʼ weg!
en: Then David blessed the Lord in the sight of all the assembly. David said,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, legúʼ gwɔ́ mbwó gù, metʉ̀ ntsèm gwɔ́ pɔ́ mú, ɔ̀ pú ńŋwʉŋe, ɔ̀ pǔ ńgúʼ tɛʼ; mélàʼmie akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tÿǒ lefaŋ, mbɔɔ ndùmo Ssé tsetsáʼ, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwó gù; Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù zɔɔ fùɔ, ɔ̀ pú ńcʉa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa wó.
en: Yours, Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the splendor and the majesty, for everything in the heavens and on earth belongs to you. Yours, Lord, is the kingdom, and you are exalted as head over all.

ngiemboon: Afùʼ, mbɔɔ legúʼ pǔ fóo pɔ́ mbwó gù; gù zɔ pú sáʼa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ. Ngʉ̀ʼ mbɔɔ metʉ̀ gwɔ́ pɔ́ mbwó gù, gù zɔ kuʼu légÿo nyìŋ gúʼ, ḿbiŋ tʉte.
en: Riches and honor come from you, and you are the ruler of everything.   Power and might are in your hand, and it is in your hand to make great and to give strength to all.  # 29:12 2Ch 20:6

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, tá peg ne ńguʼte gú, ḿbiŋe ne sáʼa tʉ̀nzẅìŋ lezíŋ shú, gù Ssé yeg.
en: Now therefore, our God, we give you thanks and praise your glorious name.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n gee páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wɔ́? Aláʼ yɔ́ɔn kuʼu na kɔ́, tà ńkuʼu lélɔg yɔɔn ntí shúm, ńtóo ńnáa mbwó gù? Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ zɔɔn fóo pɔ́ mbwó gù, ammó gie ngwɔ́ peg ná gíŋe fóo pɔ́ mbwó gù!
en: But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to give as generously as this? For everything comes from you, and we have given you only what comes from your own hand.

ngiemboon: Peg ée mvfò gù, ńgwɔ́ megʉ̀, ńgwɔ́ megàŋ legúɔ pie é té néŋe wɔ́, páʼ pamángʉanjʉʼ pég; melyɛ̌ʼ láʼ még ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ jʉjʉ́ŋ gẅie à ye gǎd ḿmag la.
en: For we are aliens and temporary residents in your presence as were all our ancestors.   Our days on earth are like a shadow, without hope.  # 29:15 Jb 14:2,10–12

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé yeg, peg ka cúʼte shúm fàʼ lélɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá gie peg ge guʼte lezíŋ shú wó; gù gẅie ée ndàʼ gú ńgwɔ́ Ssé; tá sɛ̌ shúm ntsèm ké fóo pɔ́ mbwó gù, akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gwɔ́ pɔ́ jú!
en: Lord our God, all this wealth that we’ve provided for building you a house for your holy name comes from your hand; everything belongs to you.

ngiemboon: E Ssé yɔ̀ɔn, n ne ńzsé ngie ɔ̀ líe mentʉ́m pʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ ńkwoŋo mmó gie áa ndʉŋndʉŋ; n ka lɔg pɔ́ ntʉ́m mbòŋo tá ńná shúm fùʼ sɔ́ɔn, m biŋe ne ńdɔgɔ lekág, ńgyá páʼ pʉ̀a pú pie ée jʉʼɔɔn gíŋe ne ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ púʼu.
en: I know, my God, that you test the heart   and that you are pleased with what is right.  # 29:17 Ps 15:2 I have willingly given all these things with an upright heart, and now I have seen your people who are present  # 29:17 Lit found here giving joyfully and  # 29:17 Or now with joy I’ve seen your people who are present here giving willingly to you.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie ɔɔ Ssé Ábalam, ńgwɔ́ Ssé Ésàg mbɔɔ ye Yakwɔ̂b, pie ée pamángʉanjʉʼ pég, gÿo ngie pʉ̀a láʼ pú ké ńgẅiin pɔ́ menkwaŋá mbòŋo pɛ́ʼɛ̀ tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m pɔ́b, ńké ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ntsèm pɔ́ na gù.
en: Lord God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our ancestors, keep this desire forever in the thoughts of the hearts of your people, and confirm their hearts toward you.

ngiemboon: Gÿo míŋ wɔ̀ɔn Salémo záb ntʉ́m na gù, ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na membʉ̌ mú ntsèm, mbɔɔ mentÿɔgɔ́ mú, ńgiŋ páʼ ɔ̀ ne ńkwoŋo! Gÿo à kwɛ́ ndá gie n ka lǎʼ ńcúʼte shúm sɛ̌ ntsèm lɔɔn!»
en: Give my son Solomon an undivided heart to keep and to carry out all your commands, your decrees, and your statutes,   and to build the building for which I have made provision.  # 29:19 1Ch 29:2

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ la kuʼ, Ndavîd gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó láʼa ntsèm ngie: «Tsétsɔʼ, pi na ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé gi.» Aláʼ ntsèm leen ńké ńná ndǎg mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé pamángʉanjʉʼ pɔ́b. Pɔ́ la sẅɛ́ʼ ńkẅíʼte mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mbɔɔ mvfò fùɔ.
en: Then David said to the whole assembly, “Blessed be the Lord your God.” So the whole assembly praised the Lord God of their ancestors.   They knelt low and paid homage to the Lord and the king.  # 29:20 Ex 4:31

ngiemboon: Njÿó la lʉ́a, pɔ́ gʉa ńnuŋe pwɔʼ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ḿbiŋ gwaa nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm: ńná melúm fòŋ tàʼ ntsáʼ, ńná mekùkwòon tàʼ ntsáʼ, ńgÿo púɔ njʉ̀njÿò tàʼ ntsáʼ; pɔ́ la gíŋe ńná shúm pwɔʼ ntse ntse. Pɔ́ la ná shúm pwɔʼ tà é gyɔ́ɔn, é sie é ge kuʼu lélɔg ńjÿɔ́g pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ pie é laa wó.
en: The following day they offered sacrifices to the Lord and burnt offerings to the Lord: a thousand bulls, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, along with their drink offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la néŋe mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lyɛʼó, ńdɔgɔ lekág ḿpfɛ́ ḿbiŋ ńnú, afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, pɔ́ gíŋe ńtsɔ́ʼɔ Salémo míŋ fùɔ Ndavîd na lekwò mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ. Pɔ́ la zɔ́ʼɔ yé, ńdɔg ńgÿo fùɔ páʼ à ge faʼa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Pɔ́ la gíŋe ńzɔ́ʼɔ Sandɔg, ńdɔg ńgÿo nùŋepwɔʼ welÿò.
en: They ate and drank with great joy in the Lord’s presence that day.

ngiemboon: Salémo la néŋe na lʉŋe lefùɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńjÿó ndá tá we Ndavîd. À la ne sáʼa kwaʼ mboŋó, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ júʼ ncwò wé.
en: Solomon sat on the Lord’s throne as king in place of his father David. He prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.

ngiemboon: Metándá ntsèm, mbɔɔ palÿɔ́ʼncù, ńgÿo penkʉ́ fùɔ Ndavîd metsèm la zẅíŋe léjúʼ ncwò fùɔ Salémo.
en: All the leaders and the mighty men, and all of King David’s sons as well, pledged their allegiance to King Solomon.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la lɔgɔ fùɔ Salémo, ńgÿo fùɔ welÿò, à la kwéʼe nzẅìŋ wé mvfò pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ metsèm; ńgÿo lefùɔ sé gẅiin mekùʼ tà ńcʉa petsɔ́ mefùɔ pie é la vɔg ńgwɔ́ Ésàlayɛ.
en: The Lord highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel   and bestowed on him such royal majesty as had not been bestowed on any king over Israel before him.  # 29:25 1Kg 3:13; 2Ch 1:12

ngiemboon: Ndavîd míŋ Yesêe laa fùɔ tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Ésàlayɛ ntsèm.
en: David son of Jesse was king over all Israel.

ngiemboon: À la sáʼ pa Ésàlayɛ na mengùʼu láʼ móm lekùɔ: é sáʼa láʼ Embeloŋ ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ sáʼa Yelúzálèm ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b tá lé móm tá.
en: The length of his reign over Israel was forty years; he reigned in Hebron for seven years and in Jerusalem for thirty-three.

ngiemboon: À la gwaa kwé, mbà à zẅǐŋ tɛʼ, à la gẅiin shúm fùʼ tɛʼ, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin legúʼ. Míŋ we Salémo zɔ la táa ńkúbe twó yé.
en: He died at a good old age,   full of days,  # 29:28 1Ch 23:1 riches, and honor, and his son Solomon became king in his place.

ngiemboon: Píte na nò fùɔ Ndavîd, léfó nzyeté, ńkúu nzsoté, aa tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne Samîɛ ngyàjʉʼ, mbɔɔ ye Nataŋ gẅie aa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, mbɔɔ ye Ngâd gẅie à laa nyìŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔ̌ɔn ńnyɛ́ʼɛ nÿɔ́g mé á gyá jʉʼ.
en: As for the events of King David’s reign, from beginning to end, note that they are written in the Events of the Seer Samuel,   the Events of the Prophet Nathan,  # 29:29 2Sm 7:2–4; 12:1–7 and the Events of the Seer Gad,  # 29:29 1Sm 22:5

ngiemboon: Mɛ̌ meŋwàʼne laʼte mmó gie á la cʉate fʉ̀ʼ gie Ndavîd laa fùɔ, ńdaʼte mefàʼ mie à la kaa, ńdaʼte ngɔ́ʼ gie à la gyá, ńdaʼte mmó gie á la gÿo tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ mengwòŋ.
en: along with all his reign, his might, and the incidents that affected him and Israel and all the kingdoms of the surrounding lands.
